[coldly] You have a professional obligation to, [confident], provide care regardless of your personal, [mocking], feelings about my alleged business dealings.

[exhausted] I mean, yes, I'll do my job because, um, that's what separates us, [empathetically], but watching your platelets restore while knowing what you've, [hesitantly], done to innocent people makes me physically ill.

[boastful] My businesses have employed thousands of, [proudly], workers who otherwise would have starved in their, [condescending], home countries without the opportunities I provided them.

[anxious] Um, I've been doing this for fifteen years and, er, I've never questioned my duty to heal, [confused], until today when I realized my skills might help you, [very sad], continue destroying lives.

[manipulative] You seem like someone who understands that, [warm], the world isn't black and white, [persuasive], that sometimes difficult choices create the greatest, [philosophically], good for the most people overall.
[crying while speaking] Well, um, my own grandmother escaped trafficking in the 1960s so I mean, [quietly], every word you speak dishonors her survival.
Um, well, I didn't know. [trailing off]
The machine will beep when we're, [mechanically], done and then you'll leave and I'll spend hours, [nauseated], scrubbing my hands trying to feel, [broken], clean again. [cough]
Perhaps we both do what we, [contemplatively], must to survive in this world.
[bitterly] No. [short pause]
[resigned] We're finished here then.
[professionally] Your platelet count should normalize within, [monotone], seventy-two hours if you follow the discharge instructions.

[curious] Um, will you report this conversation to, er, anyone because I mean, [threatening], patient confidentiality laws are quite, [slowly], strict about medical professionals sharing, [carefully], private discussions.
[determined] I'll do what's right, um, just like I always have, and er, [clearly], that's all you need to know. [laugh bitterly]
[ominously] Sometimes doing what's right has, [darkly], consequences that reach further than we, [menacingly], expect, especially for those we, [whispering loudly], care about most. [long pause]
